question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this scenario, we are evaluating the probabilities surrounding Elon Musk's involvement in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 conference and his public statements regarding Bitcoin in 2024. 

1. **P** (Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?): This event is binary and depends on various factors, including Musk's schedule and interest in the event. Given Musk's previous involvement in Bitcoin discussions and events, I would estimate a relatively high probability, say around 0.60.

2. **not_P** (Will Elon Musk not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?): This is the complement of P. If P is 0.60, then not_P would be 0.40.

3. **para_P** (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?): This question is closely related to P, so I would assign a similar probability, around 0.60, indicating that it is indeed possible for him to attend.

4. **Q** (Will Elon Musk make a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024?): Given Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin and its community, I would estimate this probability to be moderate, around 0.50.

5. **P_and_Q** (Will both P and Q occur?): This joint probability requires both events to happen. Assuming P is 0.60 and Q is 0.50, I would estimate P_and_Q to be 0.30, reflecting the overlap of the two probabilities.

6. **P_or_Q** (Will either P or Q occur?): This is calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q. Therefore, P_or_Q would be 0.60 + 0.50 - 0.30 = 0.80, suggesting a high likelihood that at least one of the events will happen.

7. **Q_and_not_P** (Will both Q occur and not P occur?): This means that Musk makes a statement but does not show up at the conference. I would estimate this to be lower, around 0.20, as it requires Musk to engage with Bitcoin publicly while not attending the specific event.

8. **Q_given_P** (Given that Musk shows up at the conference, will he make a public statement about Bitcoin?): If he is present at the conference, the likelihood that he makes a statement is higher, so I would estimate this probability to be around 0.70.

Overall, the probabilities are interdependent, with P and not_P being complementary, and P_and_Q being a function of both P and Q. The estimates should respect the consistency rules, ensuring that they align mathematically.

Q_given_P: 0.70

or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.60, 0.50) <= 0.80 <= min(1, 0.60 + 0.50) is TRUE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.60 = 0.80 - 0.20 is TRUE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.60 ≈ 0.30 / 0.70 is FALSE
para: P = para_P, 0.60 = 0.60 is TRUE

and, cond consistency checks failed!

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee and Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Mike Pence or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Mike Pence or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee and Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It will resolve as **No** if either Donald Trump is not selected or Nikki Haley is selected. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley or Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Nikki Haley or Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This event is significant, as it is a major Bitcoin conference. The probability of Musk attending may depend on his schedule and interest in Bitcoin at that time. Given his previous engagements and interest in cryptocurrency, I estimate a moderate probability of 0.60 for this event.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is the complementary event to P. Since the total probability must equal 1, I estimate not_P at 0.40.

3. **para_P (Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?)**: This is essentially asking if there is any chance Musk could attend. Given that he has a history of engaging with the Bitcoin community, I would assign a higher probability, around 0.70.

4. **Q (Elon Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin at any event in 2024)**: Given Musk's active engagement with Bitcoin and cryptocurrency discussions, I would assign a probability of 0.75 for him making a public statement about Bitcoin.

5. **P_and_Q (Both Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and makes a public statement about Bitcoin)**: The likelihood of both events occurring together is less than either event alone. I estimate this joint probability at 0.45.

6. **P_or_Q (Either Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or makes a public statement about Bitcoin)**: This would be higher than both individual probabilities. I estimate this probability at 0.85 since at least one of these events is likely to happen.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Musk makes a public statement about Bitcoin but does not show up at the conference)**: This scenario is plausible, especially if he discusses Bitcoin at another event. I estimate this probability at 0.30.

8. **Q_given_P (Given Musk shows up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will he make a public statement about Bitcoin?)**: If Musk attends, it’s likely he will mention Bitcoin, so I would estimate this at 0.80.

Overall, the events are interrelated, with P and Q having a strong correlation, as attendance might lead to a public statement. I will ensure that the probabilities adhere to the consistency rules outlined.
